tips.text: Place a Stonklodon early - the passive income compounds over time and funds your late-game legendary towers.
Position towers at path bends where enemies spend the most time in range.
Brachiosaurus slowing aura makes every other tower more effective - it's a force multiplier.
Keep an Ankylosaurus near your base as emergency defense - its area slam can save you from leaks.
Dilophosaurus acid pools persist between waves - use them to create permanent kill zones.
Stegosaurus piercing spikes excel against clustered enemies - place them along straight path sections.
Don't upgrade everything at once - stagger your purchases to maintain consistent defense.
Focus fire on Officers and Overseers first - they buff nearby enemies making waves harder.
Multiple Stonklodons stack - 3 early economy towers can fund an entire legendary arsenal.
Triceratops knockback into Dilophosaurus acid pools creates a deadly combo.
Steam Tanks appear every 7 waves - save burst damage or multiple slows for these minibosses.
Spinosaurus twin pools can cover multiple paths simultaneously on harder maps.
Pteranodon's massive range lets it cover multiple paths from a central position.
T-Rex fear roar affects enemies around the target, not the tower - aim for clustered groups.
Fast enemies like Explorers require slows - layer Brachiosaurus and acid pools.
Use Auto Next Wave checkbox to maintain momentum and earn completion bonuses faster.
On multi-path maps, place area damage towers where paths converge.
Selling towers returns 70% of their cost - don't be afraid to reorganize your defense.
Bleed damage from Raptor Nests stacks - multiple nests can melt tough enemies.
One well-placed tower is worth three poorly positioned ones.
Chaplains heal enemies - prioritize them or waves will last much longer.
Wave completion bonuses increase with difficulty - risk vs reward.
Ankylosaurus slam into Stegosaurus spike line devastates grouped enemies.
Jungle Ridge is forgiving for learning - practice tower combinations here.
Volcanic Pass has three paths - you'll need area coverage, not just single-target damage.
Lives are a resource - sometimes letting one enemy through to save money for a key tower is worth it.
Watch for status effect rings on enemies - blue for slow, yellow for stun.
Press R to rotate tower preview - useful for aesthetic placement.
Use 2x speed once your defense is stable to progress faster.
Engineers reduce slow effectiveness - eliminate them quickly or your crowd control fails.
